title: What's Changed
content:
There are five main models that makeup ptgolf.us

* Groups * Players* Games* Rounds * Users 

Games have three states:

* Scheduled - a new Game that may or may not have Players
* Pending - Teams have been formed. Players can still be added or deleted
* Scored - The Game is completed. You can still correct 

There was a model Course that was not used and removed. There are also utility models used by me (articles, notices)

* All CRUD actions (Create, Read, Update, Destroy) have a more consistent look and feel.  Buttons use same color and naming conventions.
* The Schedule Game form has changed from 3 columns to 2 columns
  * The status form has be moved to the first column along with action buttons 
  * The second column has two sections. The bottom section has all the players. Clicking on a Player name will move to Player to the first section. Click the update button will move the added players to the status form.
  * Once all players have been added, the Form Teams button will move the Game to a Pending status.

Scoring Teams is about the same, just a little more color separation.

Printing Scorecards now just use plain ol HTML.  Will have to test on your printer - works fine on mine.

.slim

is this going to work p.font-bold this is a another line p.text-green-600 and other Read article

.slim

p This is more or less completing something I started a year ago.
p I've updated PtGolf to use more of the new version of styling/CSS (stuff that make boxes, buttons, color etc). Some things may look a little different but I'm trying to standardize the look and feel of the application. All dashboards (top (buttons) on most pages) are now consistent.
p  I also tuned what the application looks like on a phone or tablet. It always worked half-assed on a phone in landscape mode, but I've tuned it to work a little better in portrait mode. 
p I've tested areas where I made modification, but as I've said before, I have made mistakes. Contact me if you find any problems. 

p.font-bold Steve Alex 

p 334.294.6026 

p salex@mac.com
